note: This is a standard combinatorial identity relating powers to Stirling numbers of the second kind via falling factorials. The identity k^n = Σ_{j=0}^{n} S(n,j)·(k)_j is well-established (often used as an alternative definition of S(n,j)). The equivalence (k)_j = j!·C(k,j) for k>=j follows from k!/(k-j)! = j!·[k!/(j!(k-j)!)]. The convention C(k,j)=0 for k<j is standard and consistent with (k)_j=0 for k<j.
